Ella trabaja desde las 9.00am hasta las 4.00pm.
Evangelina solicita un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras, para comprar materia prima (telas) para la elaboración de uniformes escolares, aprovechando la temporada escolar. Con esta inversión lograra aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la economía de su hogar.
Su meta en el futuro es hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, poder comprar otra maquina de coser y ofrecerle la educación necesaria a su hija.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a seamstress who specializes in making skirts, shirts, curtains, and repairing all types of garments. She began working with a sewing machine that she inherited from her mother. Her efforts are intended to move her daughter forward and help her husband earn extra household income. She started her business eight years ago. Her business has done very well and the profits she has earned have enabled her to buy more work equipment so that she can provide her customers better service. She works from 9am to 4pm.

Evangelina is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL in order to buy materials (fabrics) for making school uniforms so that she can take advantage of the school season. Her goals for the future are to make improvements to her home, purchase another sewing machine, and offer her daughter the education she needs.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet, age 22, lives in the Airport community of Liberia. She has three children between the ages of three and 15 years old. For the past five years, she been selling oil, rice, and pepper, a business she enjoys because she likes the interaction with customers and appreciates being able to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase rice, oil, and pepper for her business. Her goal is to build a family house and to ensure the education of her children. She herself was educated through the sixth grade level.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and pepper for her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 40 years old and lives in Airport, Liberia. She is married and has three children between 9 and 12 years old. For the past twenty years she has been selling oil, rice, onions, bitter ball and peppers from a table in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, pepper and bitter ball for her business. She likes her business because it's helped her to pay her children's school fees. Her plans are to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peppers and bitter ball for her business.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong, age 30, lives in Langber Bor. She is a charcoal vendor, and she has been in this business for three years. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are still in school. 
 
Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this will her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan in the amount of 500 in order to purchase charcoal to offer for sale. 

She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 24 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is single and she has two children, ages 3 and 6. Both of them are currently in school and live at home. For the past 4 years Mary has been selling used clothes in the market. She enjoys the profit-making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Gbango

texts.en: Gbango lives in the Airport community in Liberia. She is 45 years old, married, and has 8 children between 17 and 30 years old. Three are in school and live at home, while the older ones are working and living on their own. For the past thirteen years Gbango has been selling rice, pepper and oil. The main problem she is facing is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice and pepper for her business. She likes the way people respond to her business. Her plans are to become an international business woman and to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer so that he can satisfy more customers who need his services

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su querido esposo Samuel, de 56 años y sus 02 adorados hijos; Gaby de 19 años y  Brayan de 18 años; a quienes les dedica el arduo trabajo por tener un buen bienestar. Lucila, es muy dedicada a los deberes del hogar como también a su trabajo; su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos logren tener una buena educación. Hace 24 años se dedica a la venta de suministros de construcción como: fierros, cemento, pinturas, clavos, alambres, entre otros materiales. Su negocio le da muchas oportunidades de salir adelante y así poder solventar los gastos de su hogar; de la misma forma también hay dificultades cuando los clientes piden materiales que llegan a terminarse rápido. Lucila se llego a enterar sobre los préstamos que realiza MFP, y vio que era muy conveniente para su negocio y de esa forma no poder faltarle ninguna herramienta de cimentación. Este será su crédito número 17 con MFP, esta dispuesta a cumplir con sus cuotas de pago de manera puntual. En su banco es una socia muy alegre y participe de los acuerdos que aportan.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar los materiales de construcción que le hacen falta, para incrementar en su ferretería.
texts.en:
56-year-old Lucila is a very cheerful and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her beloved husband Samuel, who is 56 years old, and their two much-loved children: 19-year-old Gaby and 18-year-old Brayan.  Lucila works hard for her children so that they can live comfortably.  She is committed to both her household chores and her work.  Her greatest wish is for her children to receive a good education.

For 24 years, Lucila has been selling construction supplies such as iron, cement, paint, nails, wires and other materials.  Her business gives her a lot of opportunities to get ahead in life and cover her household expenses.  However, she experiences some difficulties when her customers request materials that run out quickly.  Lucila found out about MFP's loans and saw that they would be very useful for her business and would mean she wouldn't lack any building tools.

This will be Lucila's 17th loan from MFP and she is ready to make her repayments in a punctual manner.  She is a very cheerful member of her community bank who abides by the agreements that they reach.  She will use her 1,000 soles to buy construction supplies that she is lacking so that she can increase the stock of her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Asteria, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three children, two of whom go to school and the last one is still young.  She has been running a business of tailoring for 10 years now.  She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy fabrics and lining materials, and she bought another sewing machine. She hired tenders and sold shirts and fabrics. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more materials for making more dresses to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to become an international business woman.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Ustawi", which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making more dresses to sell.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 19 años en la ciudad de Camaná, lugar en donde también trabaja, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”.

Con mucho esfuerzo esteban logro iniciar su negocio de carpintera, el hace portones (puertas grandes), el tiene el apoyo de su esposa, es su mano derecha y su asistente estrella, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 11 hora diarias , ya que la confección de estos portones es muy trabajoso, el cree que e va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo y tiene mucha creatividad para los acabados, por ello los clientes siempre lo recomiendan.

Esteban está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar madera para la confección de sus trabajos y así poder cumplir a tiempo con los pedidos de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para salir adelante para poder comprarse un Taladro de Banco y luego cumplir su gran sueño:” Crecer como microempresario”.
texts.en:
Esteban lives with his wife and 19 year old son in Camana, where he also works. Like a good Peruvian he also likes typical Peruvian food, and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious "lomo saltado" [steak with Peruvian and Asian seasonings, served with rice and potato wedges]. 

With a lot of hard work Esteban managed to start his carpentry business. He makes large doors called "portones". He has the support of his wife, who is his right hand and star assistant. Esteban works around 11 hours daily, because the detailing for these large doors is very laborious. He believes his business is doing well because he does good work and the finished products show a lot of creativity - for which his clients always recommend him. 

Esteban is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support he will be able to buy wood to make portones and finish his clients' requests on time. This will allow him to increase his income and continue working to get ahead, to be able to buy a table drill, and then reach his great dream: "to grow as a small businessman".

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Benetha

texts.en: Benetha lives in the Airport Community. She is 43 years old, single, and has five children between the ages of 6 and 23 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past ten years she been selling rice and oil. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and rice for her business. She likes her business and the way people respond to it. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in Airport community. She is single and she has four children between the ages of 2 and 11 years old, all of whom are in school and live at home. For the past 6 years Martha has been selling charcoal and eggs in the market. She enjoys the profit-making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and eggs for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat, forty-one, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Additionally, she has been producing flat baskets to sell for over ten years as well, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is involved in construction work when he is free from his farming work, and earns about USD 4 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 6 per day. 

In order to improve her agricultural business, Sinat is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a pumping machine to use to pump water into the rice field. In the future, she would like to run a new business by raising fish to sell and help her youngest child get a bachelor degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new house to provide a better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine to use to pump water into the rice field.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, age 41, and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over 20 years. They have extensive experience in their work and are successful in their career. They grow rice and raise cattle, earning about USD 8 per day. The couple has five children: two are construction workers earning about USD 6 per day. The family lives in Kampong Chnang Province in Cambodia.

Due to the difficulty in arranging for the family’s transportation, Sina is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use for commuting. This purchase will enable her to save the money previously used for transportation and use the savings to help support her family. 

In the future, Sina would like to build a new house for in order to provide a better living conditions for the family. She aspires toward helping her children to get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for the family to use for commuting

loans.name: Fabiola Alicia

texts.es:
Fabiola es una joven de 24 años, innata del distrito de Santiago ubicada en la ciudad de Ica, Perú. Ica es una ciudad caracterizada por el desarrollo económico que ha surgido en los últimos años, también tiene las principales fabricas que se dedican a exportación de alcachofas y espárragos, los mismos que son comprados a nivel mundial, esta ciudad también se caracteriza por los terremotos sufridos en los últimos años, tras esos terribles sucesos, Ica, también conocida como “Tierra del Sol”, se ha levantado y ha mejorado incluso en algunos aspectos, es en esta ciudad donde vive y trabaja Fabiola, una joven a la que le hubiese gustado convertirse en una gran “Analista de Sistemas – Control de calidad”.

Actualmente Fabiola se dedica a la venta de raspadillas y gaseosas de lunes a viernes y los días sábado y domingo vende sus productos en una piscina, ella labora a partir de las 10 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, tiempo en el que atiende a un promedio de 40 personas, ella confía en sus clientes siempre la visitan porque se concentra mucho en la elaboración de los jarabes para sus rapadillas, los mismos que son de esencia de frutas. Ella agradece mucho a su madre por el apoyo que le brindo para que se pudiese iniciar en este negocio.

Fabiola ha tenido la idea de poder comprar más gaseosas y así tener mucha más variedad, lo que le permitirá vender rápido sus productos, debido a que nos encontramos en temporada de verano y el calor es tan intenso que los iqueños siempre necesitan refrescarse. Ella se ha prometido a si misma que con las ganancias que obtenga empezará a construir su casa, ya que es uno de sus sueños, y con mucho más esfuerzo sueña con poder comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a young woman of 24 years old, from the district of Santiago, located in Ica, Peru. Her city is characterized by its economic development which has picked up in the past couple years. Its main factories export artichokes and asparagus that are purchased worldwide. The city is also known for the earthquakes suffered in the past few years. Through these terrible events, Ica, also known as “Tierra del Sol” or “Land of the Sun” has lifted itself and has improved in some aspects. It is in this city that Fabiola lives and works. She would have liked to become a great “Systems Analyzer – Quality Controller.” 

Currently Fabiola sells snow cones and soda from Monday through Friday. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells her products at a swimming pool. She sells from 10 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon and attends to an average of 40 customers. She is confident that her customers will always come to her because she spends a lot of time making the fruit-essence syrups for her snow cones. She is thankful to her mother for her support that made it possible to start this business. 

Fabiola has had the idea to buy more soda to have more variety to sell her products more quickly. It is summer right now, and the sun is so hot that the people of Ica constantly need refreshment. She has made a promise to herself to use the earnings to begin constructing her house, since that is one of her dreams. Another dream requiring a lot more effort is to purchase her own car.

loans.use: to purchase soda

loans.name: Mirie

texts.en: Mirie lives in Airport community. She is 44 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 15. They are in school and live at home. For the past ten years she been selling palm oil. She faces the problem of the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil for her business. Her plans are to become an international businesswoman and to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, twenty-six, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over two years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband runs a business buying baskets and flat baskets to resell and earns approximately USD 4 per day. 

Due to the lack of income, Vanny wants to have an additional career to generate more income to support the family. With this goal in mind, Vanny is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to purchase more piglets to breed and rebuild her present house to make it stronger which will provide better living conditions for the family. Moreover, she wants her children to get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to breed in order to sell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián, de 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres en su haber. Juntos residen en su casa propia donde se brindan amor  y cuidado. El señor Julián se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura; en compañía de su esposa se dirigen a los campos de cultivo desde la madruga para dirigirse a su parcela donde tiene cultivado plantas de café, lleva 19 años obteniendo la producción de café y en tiempos de colecta ve los resultados de todo el empeño que pone desde el tiempo que llegó a cultivar hasta el día de su cosecha. Julián, considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir con los animales que afectan a sus plantas; por lo que disminuye sus frutos; es por eso que acude a las oficinas de MFP, para poder solicitar un préstamo que ayude a tener buena producción. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera oportuna, además, se siente satisfecho con su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, servirá para darle un mejoramiento de sus plantaciones de café, por ello va a contratar jornaleros.
texts.en:
Julian, 33 years old, is married and has three children.  They live together in their own house with love and care.  Julian works in agriculture.  He goes out to the fields with his wife in the early morning hours, going to his parcel where he plants coffee.  He has grown coffee for 19 years and at harvest time the results of his hard work from planting to harvest are evident.  

Julian believes that the most difficult thing is not being able to combat the animals that affect his plants.  Because of them, there are fewer fruits.  For this reason he went to he offices of MFP, in order to request a loan that will help him improve production.  This will be his second loan with MFP, which he promises to pay on time, and he is pleased with his communal bank.  The 1000 nuevos soles will help him to improve his coffee fields.  He will use it to hire day laborers.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun, sixty, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and other agricultural crops. Additionally, they run a business selling coal to generate more income to support the family. They earn approximately USD 7 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Hun is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase farmland to grow more agricultural crops. By doing so, she would generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm land to grow more agricultural crops.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan is one of the residents who has been operating a rice farm in Kompong Cham province. She is 33 and is married with a single child who is attending a local school. Chhan’s spouse is engaged in the same type of business and is the one who always manages most of the work on the rice field. This couple tries to work hard. They grow rice both in the rainy season and the dry season. However, they can earn only a low income because they own only a few hectares of farmland. 

Now Chhan would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase fertilizer and insecticide to spread over the land to make her plants grow well. Chhan has received loans from our MFI 5 times already. She is an honest client who always pays her loan on time as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide to spread over the land to make her plants grow well.

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en: Rotha, forty, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been selling timber for over six years, earning approximately USD 16 per day. In order to improve her business, Rotha is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more timber to sell in order to generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use further profit to expand her business, build a new house and help her children get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell in order to generate more profit.

loans.name: Bahati Group

texts.en:
Sofia, who is in her early 50s, is married with four grown up children, all of whom are independent. She stays with three grandchildren who are going to school. She has two businesses, selling beer at wholesale prices and a food cafe. She works from 6:30 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her businesses and has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to open a clothing shop. Her dream is to one day be able to open a bigger clothing shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Bahati" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to open a clothing shop.

loans.name: To

texts.en:
To, forty-seven, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over ten years, have an extensive experience, and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs to sell. Approximately, they earn USD 10 per day. 

Due to the family's transportation difficulties, To is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on transport to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide a better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Yot

texts.en: Yot, 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for over ten years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about USD 5 per day. In order to improve her agricultural business, Yot is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cattle for using in her farming work. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger, to provide better living conditions for the family, and to help her children get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for using in her farming work.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 50 años, es una mujer muy contenta y agradecida con las personas que le apoyan; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Pelayo, de 49 años y sus 04 adorables hijos. María y su esposo Pelayo quien le brinda bastante apoyo en la actividad que efectúan ambos; llevan trabajando juntos durante 18 años en la venta de zapatos, sandalias, etc. María, como mujer sabe las preferencias especiales de cada señora o señorita que acude a su tienda; mientras que Pelayo, sabe los gustos de los caballeros y así mutuamente se apoyan ambos quienes traen calzados especiales para los clientes de la ciudad de San francisco. Sin embargo también tienen dificultades al terminar rápido lo zapatos de exclusividad que la mayoría de sus clientes llega a comprarle. Por tal motivo acude a MFP, para poder facilitarle un préstamo que pueda ayudar con su labor y así logre comprar zapatos en cantidad de  ciudad de Lima para sus clientes de la ciudad de San francisco. Este será su crédito número 07 con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual con las cuotas de pago para que en otra oportunidad pueda acceder a otro crédito. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria con sus compañeros. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará zapatos para incrementar en su negocio.
texts.en:
50-year-old María is a very happy woman who is grateful to the people who support her.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Pelayo, who is 49, and their four beautiful children.  María and her husband Pelayo, who supports her in their joint business, have been working together for 18 years selling shoes, sandals, etc.  As a woman, María knows the special preferences of each lady, young or old, who comes to their store whilst Pelayo knows the tastes of the gentlemen.  This is how the couple support each other.  They both bring back special footwear for their customers from the city of San Francisco.  However, they experience difficulties when they quickly run out of the exclusive shoes that most of their customers come to buy.  For this reason, María is turning to MFP to provide her with a loan that could help her business by enabling her to buy shoes in bulk in the city of Lima.

This will be María's seventh loan from MFP and she knows that she must be punctual in making her repayments so that she can obtain another loan in the future.  She is a very cheerful member of her community bank and is very supportive of her fellow group members.  She will use her 3,000 soles to buy shoes so that she can grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Azul Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo de entusiastas mujeres que pertenecen al grupo de Azul. Son seis conocidas y vecinas que pertenecen al municipio de Apodaca.
Entre sus integrantes se encuentra Carmen, madre de dos hijos. Ella inicio un negocio de abarrotes en su domicilio hace un año y el resultado ha sido muy favorecedor, incluso más de lo imaginaba. Esto la motivo para comprometerse con este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras a adquirir un crédito que le permitiera ampliar la variedad de producto y aumentar la mercancía que hoy tiene a la venta.
Ella confía en que esta inversión rendirá muy buenos frutos, los cuales le ratificaran con una mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This is a group of enthusiastic women who belong to the group Azul ("Blue").  They are six friends and neighbors who live in the town of Apodaca.  

Among them is Carmen, a mother of two children.  She began a grocery business in her house one year ago with very good results, even better than she imagined. This is why she has committed herself to this group of enterprising women to take a loan to increase the variety of products and increase the merchandise that she has for sale.  

She is confident that this investment will yield good results that she can use to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise to increase the variety of the business.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von, fifty-one, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, she earns USD 4 per day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory and earn about USD 9 per day. 

Because her house has not been completed, Von is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase timbers to cover her house’s wall. This loan will enable her to make her family live more comfortably. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to cover her house's wall?

loans.name: Ninoska Victoria

texts.es: Doña Ninoska, tiene 2 hijos ambos están en la escuela, es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de  tortilla, desde hace 10 años. Empezó con este negocio a los 23 años de edad con dinero propio , ha sido su único negocio el cual le ha permitido sobrevivir durante estos años y le ha  ayudado a salir adelante con su familia no cuenta con otros ingresos . Ella expresa que  el lugar donde  comercializa sus tortillas esta bien. Aunque no es una cocina de lujo ni mucho menos industrial, ella trabaja desde muy  tempranas horas de la madrugada, a prepara su comal hecho de lata y leña. Comenzando a elaborar sus tortillas de maíz y venderlas en su  domicilio. El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de leña y  maíz ya que son la principal materia prima con la que realiza su producto. Sus metas futuras son mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, tales como ponerle zinc, mejorar la infraestructura ya que no se encuentran en buenas condiciones la cocina , con el objetivo de brindar una buena atención  y satisfacción de su cliente y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ninoska has two children who are both in school.  She is a saleswoman and has been selling tortillas for ten years.  She started this business at the age of 23 with her own money.  This has been her only business and it has enabled her to survive over the years and helped her to provide for her family which doesn't have any other income.  She says that the place where she sells her tortillas is OK, though it is not a luxury kitchen, much less an industrial one.  Ninoska works from very early in the morning, preparing her tortillas using a tortilla pan made from tin and firewood.  She starts making her corn tortillas which she then sells from her home.

Ninoska requested this loan to buy firewood and corn which are the main raw materials she uses in making her products.  Her future goals are to improve her business by installing metal sheeting and improving its infrastructure as her kitchen is not in very good condition.  She will do this in order to provide her customers with good service and satisfaction and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Martha Cecilia Montoya

texts.es:
Martha es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante le han permito superar las dificultades y continuar en la vida junto a su familia. Martha, casada y madre de 2 hijas tuvo que abandonar junto con su esposo su municipio natal debido a la violencia, buscando en la ciudad de Medellín mayores oportunidades de progresar económicamente. Martha es una persona con muy bajos recursos económicos, sin embargo su esposo, quien es oficial de construcción, construyó una vivienda de madera donde pueden vivir con lo necesario. Martha se dedica a la elaboración de postres, los cuales vende a familiares y amigos, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Debido a que Martha no tiene donde almacenar sus postres para ser transportados por mucho tiempo, tiene que hacer varios recorridos desde su casa hasta sus clientes para que los postres no se dañen, y esto hace que a menudo encuentre clientes nuevos interesados en su producto pero no tenga productos con los cuales pueda satisfacer sus pedidos. Con el ánimo de mejorar esta situación, Martha aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una caja de poliestireno expandido el cual le permita guardar de forma refrigerada sus postres y le permitan almacenar una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes en los recorridos que hace.

Martha espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender pedidos de clientes que antes no podía atender por los pocos productos que podía transportar. Además, Martha sueña con que su negocio salga adelante y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda comercializar sus postres hacia otros sectores y pueda tener una microempresa en la cual genere empleo para las personas que al igual que ella tienen pocos recursos económicos. Martha quiere también ofrecerles a sus 2 hijas la oportunidad de acceder a una educación de mayor calidad y en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Martha is person that has had to traverse much adversity in her life. However, her desire to work and move forward has allowed her to overcome the difficulties and continue in life together with her family. Martha, married and mother of two daughters, had to abandon, together with her husband, their home town due to violence, looking for better opportunities to progress economically in the city of Medellín. Martha is a person with little economic resources. However, her husband who is in construction, constructed housing of wood where they could live with the necessities. Martha makes desserts for a living, which she sells to family and friends, and thanks to this generates the income necessary to sustain the household expenses. Because of that, Martha doesn't have a place to store her pastries to be transported for much time. She has to make various runs from the house to her clients so that the pastries aren't ruined. She often meets new clients that are interested in her product but she doesn't have products with which she can satisfy their requests. With the aim of improving her situation, Martha aspires for a loan that provides her the opportunity of accessing the purchase of a styrofoam box which will allow her to save, in a refridgerated way, her pastries and allow her to store a better quality product to offer to her clients on the runs that she makes. 

Martha hopes that her income increases considerable, so she will be able to attend to the requests of her clients that before she couldn't because of what few products she could transport. Furthermore, Martha dreams of her business becoming successful and in the near future she will be able to commercialize her desserts to other sectors and have a micro-business in which she generates employment for people like her that have few economic resources. Martha also wants to offer her two daughters the opportunity of accessing a high quality education and in the future a university education.

loans.use: to purchase a styrofoam box that allows her to save in a refrigerated way their pastries and allows them to store a better quality of products to offer to their customers on the runs that they make.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David, es una persona a quien le gusta la formalidad y el empeño en su labor; tiene 34 años, vive en la casa de su hermana junto a su pareja Edith de 24 años y ambos anhelan tener su propia vivienda y poder estar tranquilos. David, es un hombre de provecho, se dedica a trabajar como obrero en las construcciones que realizan las Municipalidades; esta actividad lleva realizando hace 04 años y le gusta llevarse bien con sus colegas de faena; a Edgar le remuneran  muy bien en sus pagos por ser un buen obrero, aunque se le haga difícil tener que labor en el pleno calor donde a veces llega a cansarse muy rápido al igual que sus  compañeros. Por otro lado gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo; llegó a comprarse un terreno con sus ganancias; el cual ya pudo avanzar con la construcción de su vivienda para tener una buena estadía. Ahora con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, ladrillo y lo todo lo necesario  para culminar con la fachada de su hogar. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP; por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos; por otro lado se compromete cumplir con cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá terminar de construir su casa  y así tendrá un hogar muy tranquilo donde pueda vivir bien.
texts.en: David is a person who likes formality and dedication in his work. He is 34 years old, and he lives in his sister's house together with his partner Edith, age 24. Both share the desire to have their own home so they can be comfortable. David is a solid man who works as a laborer in construction projects carried out by the municipalities. He has been doing this work for 4 years, and he likes to get along well with his colleagues on the job. Edgar is paid very well on payday because he is a good worker, although it is hard for him to work in very hot weather; he sometimes becomes tired very quickly, as do his fellow workers. However, thanks to his dedication and effort, he has been able to buy a piece of land with his earnings, and he has been able to make progress with the construction of his house, in order to have a good place to live. Now, with the loan he has requested, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, and all of the things he needs to complete the outside of his house. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he hopes for your support to continue toward his goals. He is committed to making his payments as scheduled. With the 1,500 Peruvian new soles, he will be able to finish building his house, and thus he will have a very tranquil home where he can live well.

loans.use: to finish constructing his house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre de sus hijos. Vive en su propia casa en compañía de su madre y sus 2 hijos de 20  y 4 años de edad. 
La actividad que realiza Rita es la venta de periódicos, para esto se levanta muy de temprano en la madrugada y se dirige a la imprenta donde compra sus mercaderías, y se dispone a venderlo de forma ambulatoria caminado por las calles de la ciudad hasta acabar en vender todo. Vende de manera amable y cordial, ganándose la preferencia de sus clientes quienes la esperan todas las mañanas por sus periódicos a diarios. Tiene más de 15 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su hija en la venta de los mismos.
Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos y por ser su principal fuente de ingreso, habiéndole dado muchas satisfacciones, gracias a la cual a logrado pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de continuar en su negocio y mantenerlo. Este será el préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como periódicos de diversas imprentas para tener mayor variedad que ofertar, buscando menos precios por sus compras al contado.
texts.en:
Rita is a 40 year-old hardworking woman who is resolute in her drive to push herself forward. She is separated from the father of her children. She lives in her own home with her mother and two children, ages 20 and 4. 

Rita’s occupation is selling newspapers. She wakes up in the early morning and goes to the press to purchase her merchandise. Then she sells by walking around the streets of the city until she has sold each one. She is friendly and polite to her customers, which wins the preference of her customers who wait for her each morning for their daily newspaper. She has worked in this business for over 15 years, and now she has the help of her daughter. 

She likes the business because it earns her an income, which is her principal source of income. It has given her a lot of satisfaction since she has succeeded in paying for the education of her children. She considers the business worthwhile because of the income it provides her; therefore, she plans to continue maintaining her business. This will be her 7th loan with MFP, and she hopes that collaborating will help her achieve her plans. She also likes the bank because the group has unity and solidarity. 

She will use the 1000 Nuevos Soles (PEN) she is requesting to invest in newspapers from diverse printing presses, so that she can have a large selection to offer. The loan will also allow her to pay in a single cash payment and get lower prices.

loans.use: buy more newspapers.

loans.name: Avilio

texts.es:
Avilio de 30 años convive con Norma con quien tiene 2 hijos: Herman de 7 y Danitza de 3 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené – Chanchamayo.
Avilio trabaja desde que era un niño. A su corta edad ya trabajaba en los terrenos de cultivos de sus padres, así aprendió sobre la actividad agrícola, con la que actualmente, mantiene  a su familia. 
Cuenta con 3 lotes de terrenos en los que siembra café y achiote. “La venta de achiote es rentable en Satipo, de mi parcela estoy cosechando 1500 kilos”, comenta.
Cuando el trabajo en las chacras no requiere de más cuidados, se dedica a laborar como jornalero en otras parcelas. Así obtiene otros ingresos para sus gastos diarios.
Toda su producción la comercializa en el mercado de frutas de Satipo, ahí llegan compradores de varias ciudades, quienes pagan un precio justo por sus cosechas.
Uno de sus propósitos es adquirir más terrenos. Para eso deberá invertir en la compra o arriendo de las mismas, ya que las ventas de café y achiote son más que beneficiosas.
Éste sería su préstamo número 3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los productores Inchatingari” es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que siente apego por que los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
De obtener el dinero del crédito, Avilio pagará el servicio de los jornaleros a quienes contratará para limpiar sus terrenos de cultivos. Por cada uno invierte de 20 a 25 soles al día.
texts.en:
Avilio, 30, lives with Norma, with whom he has 2 children: Herman, 7, and Danitza, 3.  This family lives in their own home in the indigenous community of Inchatingari in the district of Perene, in Chanchamayo province.

Avilio has worked ever since he was a child.  Even at a young age, he was already working cultivating his parent's land, and this is how he learned to farm. He now supports his family working as a farmer. 

He has 3 plots of land where he cultivates coffee and achiote trees.  "The sale of achiote is profitable in Satipo, and from my parcel of land I am harvesting 1,500 kilos," he comments.

When his fields require no further care, he hires himself out as a farmworker to work on other parcels of land. This way he gets extra income for his daily expenses.

He sells all of his products in the Satipo fruit market. Buyers come to this market from various cities, and they pay a fair price for his harvested products. 

One of Avilio's goals is to acquire more land.  To do this, he will invest in the purchase or rental of land, since his sales of coffee and achiote seeds are very profitable. 

This will be his 3rd loan from MFP. As such, he promises that he will be punctual with his monthly payments. The name of his group is “Productores Inchatingari," and he feels very attached to this group of responsible and supportive people.   Upon receiving this loan, Avilio will pay for farmworkers that he will hire to clear his fields.  He will pay each worker 20-25 Peruvian soles per day.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 56 años, es una mujer alegre y sencilla; vive en su propia casa junto a su amado esposo Emiliano, de 54 años y sus 05 queridos hijos a quienes brinda una buena estadía. Reyna, es alegre, responsable y dedicada al gran trabajo que cumple. Hace 19 años llego a abrir su restaurante que con gran esfuerzo logró obtener gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de laborar. Hasta ahora con la ayuda de su querido esposo puede cumplir con otros trabajos que desea tener para mas adelante. Por otro lado prioriza en mejorar su restaurante y poder comprar productos naturales de Omnilife, que con grandes aspiraciones espera a vender. Por tal motivo visita a las oficinas de MFP, para solicitar un préstamo que ayude con los planes de trabajo que tiene preparado para su futuro. Este será su crédito numero 16 con MFP, se compromete a ser muy puntual con los pagos y no quedar mal con los financieros. Asimismo, en su banco comunal es una socia participe de las reuniones y aporta ideas para trabajar en compañerismo.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará los productos naturales para que pueda vender y con el resto comprará las necesidades para su restaurante.
texts.en: Reyna, a 56 year old woman, is a very happy and simple person. She lives in her own house with her beloved husband Emiliano, who is 54 years old, and  their five beloved children, who are well taken care of. Reyna is happy, responsible and dedicated to her work. With great effort, she was able to open her own restaurant nineteen years ago. Thanks to her perseverance and desire to work, she was able to achieve this goal. Until now she has been able to work on some side projects that she wants to develop for the future, with the help of her dear husband. On the other hand, she prioritizes the improvement of her restaurant and being able to buy Omnilife natural products that she has very much hopes to sell. For this reason, she visits the MFP offices, to request a loan that would help her with these future business plans. This will be her sixteenth loan with MFP and she commits to making her loan payments on time and to impress the loan financiers. In addition, she is a member of a communal bank and participates in meetings and contributes ideas to the group. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy the natural products to sell and will use the rest to buy necessities for her restaurant.

loans.use: purchase ingredients, especially natural ingredients, to prepare food.

loans.name: Kefayah

texts.en:
Kefayah is a 27-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is conservative and unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. Thus, the man in the photo is her husband.

Kefayah is a proud owner of a farm on which she breeds goats and sheep to use for producing milk and making cheese.

Kefayah is requesting a youth loan of 1500 JD to purchase goats to increase the volume of milk produced.

Kefayah is looking to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani is a 20-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is selling blankets and requested a youth loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to purchase greater quantities. Amani is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 27-year-old man from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. He sells women's scarves and shawls. Raed is requesting a youth loan of 800 Jordanian dinars to purchase larger quantities so that he can increase his sales volume and thus his income. Raed is looking to have one of his family members working with him to help.

loans.use: to purchase women's scarves and shawls for trading purposes

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a conservative person, so she is unwilling to have her picture uploaded on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband. 

She is a 28-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan, and the mother of three children.

Hanadi is requesting a youth loan of 400 JOD to paint her house with an aspiration of improving her family life conditions.

loans.use: to paint her house.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, que le gusta los retos y los negocios. Es conviviente con Jorge quien es comerciante y padre de sus 3 hijos Jorge de 18, Pablo de 5 y Jaky de 6 años de edad. Juntos viven en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo y la colaboración de su pareja.
 La actividad que tiene Luz es la elaboración  y venta de escobas para eso cuenta con pequeño taller instalado en su casa, donde tiene 2 maquinas para realizar los corte de los palitos y las cerdas, luego los ensambla logrado sacar un buen producto. Todos sus productos son vendidos al por mayor a los comerciantes de los mercados cercanos, donde tiene pedidos por entregar por la buena atención que brinda.
Se inició hace más de 18 años con un capital propio y en sociedad con su pareja, quien la ayuda en la elaboración y venta de sus productos, y en ocasiones también cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le genera, además de contar con una clientela habitual que le consumen sus productos terminando de vender todo lo que produce.
Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenia problemas económicos ya que no contaba con un oficio ni ingresos constantes haciendo que la economía en su casa sea difícil viendo sufrir a sus hijos, viendo esto tomo la decisión de trabajar.  
Ahora viendo los buenos resultados que sigue teniendo desea continuar pues es su única fuete de ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta que esta contenta con su trabajo de su banco comunal por el apoyo que brindan a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus escobas como palitos y cerdas, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en cantidad, para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Luz is a hard-working and dedicated 38-year-old woman who likes challenges and business. She is married to Jorge, who is a merchant and father of their three children: Jorge, 18; Jaky, 6; and Pablo, 5. They live together in their own home that they bought with a lot of hard work and collaboration. Luz makes a living making and selling brooms out of a small workshop in her home. She has two machines to cut the sticks and bristles, and then she assembles them to ensure a good product. All of her products are sold wholesale to nearby merchants, where she has delivery orders thanks to the good service she provides. She started more than 18 years old with her own money and the support of her husband, who helps her in making and selling the brooms. Sometimes her eldest son helps out as well. She considers the business to be quite lucrative due to the profits she generates and the regular customer base that buys up everything she produces. Before starting the business she had some financial problems because she didn't have a trade or regular income, making the household finances difficult. She didn't want to see her children to suffer, so she decided to work. Now she sees the good results from her job, and she wants to continue because it is her only source of income. This will be her sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very content knowing she has financial support and can continue advancing with her business. She also says that she enjoys her work with her community bank because of the supportive people. She plans to use the loan to purchase materials to make brooms, like sticks and straw bristles, at lower prices by buying in bulk, and thus increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase sticks and straw bristles to make brooms.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Adilia, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Es conviviente con Alejandro quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus hijos por quienes se esfuerza en salir adelante. Juntos viven en su casa propia que compró con el apoyo de su pareja. La actividad que realiza Adilia es la venta de pescado frescos que compra por las madrugas en el puerto de la localidad para luego llevarlos a vender en su puesto en el mercado de su ciudad, atendiendo de manera amable y atenta a sus clientes que siempre le consumen sus productos. Se inicio hace más de 5 años con un capital propio, gracias a la iniciativa de su hermana quien la animo viendo las necesidades que sufría. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, y que logra acabar con todos su mercadería que oferta.
Antes de empezar con su negocio sufría muchas  dificultades por la escasez de trabajo, además le gusta los negocios y busco generarse sus propios ingresos para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los ingresos obtenidos desea ampliar y seguir creciendo, además de querer abrir una tienda en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, por el apoyo que vienen brindando a las personas con negocio y lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería que es el pescado fresco buscando precios bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen, además acondicionará su casa para montar una bodega y en donde venderá productos de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Adilia, who is 43 years old, is a hard-working and determined woman, in addition to being friendly and happy. She lives with Alejandro, who works in transportation and is the father of their children, for whom she strives to advance. They live together in their own house, which she bought with the help of her partner. Adilia's business is the sale of fresh fish, which she buys early in the morning at the local port to later take them to sell at her stall in the Bellavista market, where she serves her customers, who always buy her products, in a kind and attentive manner. She began this business more than 5 years ago with some capital of her own, thanks to the initiative of her sister, who encouraged her, seeing the needs she suffered, and so far she has been working alone. She considers her business fairly profitable because of the good earnings that it gives her, and because she manages to sell all the merchandise that she offers.

Before beginning her business she suffered many difficulties because of the scarcity of work. In addition, she liked business and looked for a way to generate her own income to help her partner with the household expenses. Therefore, now that she sees the income she has obtained, she wants to expand and continue growing, in addition to wanting to open a shop in her house. This will be her third loan with MFP.  For this she hopes for your assistance so that she can make her plans a reality. In addition, she feels comfortable with her communal bank because of the support that they offer to people with businesses, and she considers her group united and community-minded.

With the 1200 PEN that she has applied for, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise, that is, fresh fish, seeking lower prices by buying in volume and paying cash. In addition she will make arrangements in her house to set up a store to sell groceries.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of fish.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es: Constantino, es un hombre muy laborioso, tiene 49 años de edad, está felizmente casado con su esposa Leonarda de 50 años, tiene 4 hijos, a quienes brinda amor. Constantino, es un hombre al que le gusta la labor del campo, se dedica a labrar la tierra para luego cultivar plantas de cacao, actividad que realiza hace 30 años. En tiempos de cosecha acude donde sus vecinos para que le brinden ayuda para poder extraer de manera rápida los frutos; luego los lleva a vender a los centros de acopio mas cercano a  su localidad quienes le remuneran buenas ganancias por sus granos de cacao. Ahora su mayor necesidad es poder culminar con la construcción de su casa. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y está muy agradecido por haberle apoyado con éste crédito pues significa mucho para continuar trabajando. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales (fierros, alambres, clavos, etc.) para culminar con la construcción de su hogar.
texts.en:
Constantino is a very industrious man. He is 49 years old and happily married to his wife, Leonarda, who is 50 years old. He has four children whom he loves very much. 

Constantino is a man who likes to work in the fields. He makes a living working the land to cultivate cacao plants. He has been doing this for 30 years. During the harvest time he goes to his neighbors for help in order to be able to pick the fruit quickly. Later he takes them to the closest wholesale market in his area where they give him a good profit for his cacao beans. 

His biggest necessity right now is to be able to finish the construction of his house. This will be his first loan with MFP and he is very grateful for the support that will allow him to continue working in his business. With the 2,000 nuevos soles he will buy materials (metal, wire, nails, etc.) to finish building his home.

loans.use: to buy metal, wire, and nails to finish building his house.

loans.name: Nayfeh

texts.en:
Nayfeh is a 27-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan.

Nayfeh is looking to improve her family's life conditions so she is requesting a youth loan of 500 JOD to purchase new furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her home.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer decidida y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial. Es conviviente con Roy quien es empleado y padre de su única hija de 3 años de edad por quien se esfuerzan en salir adelante. Están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. La actividad que realiza Reyna es la venta de jugos de caña de azúcar. Para esto tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su ciudad, asimismo adquirió una maquina moledora que le ayuda en su actividad. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano y se dirige a realizar las compras de materia que es la caña de azúcar para llevarlo a su puesto de venta donde las exprime y vende con hielo para que tenga una temperatura al agrado de sus clientes. Se inició hace más de 3 meses, comenta que había realizado la siembra de varias hectáreas de caña de azúcar y la producción sería vendida a un solo comprador, pero el negocio no prospero quedándose con la producción de caña sin poder venderla. Ante ésta dificultad, tuvo la idea de venderla en jugos para no perder su producción. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados que tiene y las ganancias que le deja, tiene planes de continuar en su negocio. Es más, quiere adquirir con las ganancias una unidad de trasporte de carga para el traslado de las cañas de azúcar, así como volver a sembrar varias hectáreas más para abastecer a su propio negocio. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de  saber que podrá contar con una línea de crédito para continuar con  su negocio. Por tanto, dice será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio y acceso a más créditos en el futuro. Por otro lado, comenta estar contento con su banco comunal pues conoce a todos sus miembros y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá  como parte de pago de la compra de una unidad de trasporte de carga, para el traslado de la caña de azúcar desde su terreno hasta su puesto de venta, ahorrándose de esa manera gasto de flete.
texts.en:
Reyna, 27, is a determined and persevering woman, as well as a friendly and cordial one. She lives with Roy, who is employed and the father of her only daughter, 3 years old, for whom they work to get ahead. They live comfortably in their own house that they built with much dedication and hard work.

Reyna’s business is the sale of sugar cane juice, which she does from a small stall at the market. She also has a mill that helps her in her business. Every day she gets up very early and shops for ingredients such as sugar cane to take to her stall where she presses and sells it with ice so that it is a pleasant temperature for her customers. She started her business more than 3 months ago and notes that she used to plant several hectares in sugar cane and the production would be sold to a single buyer, but the buyer's business failed and she was left with a cane harvest without being able to sell it. Seeing this problem, she had the idea of selling it as juice so as not to lose her harvest. Now, seeing the good returns she earns and the profits she makes, she plans to continue in her business.

There is more. She wants to buy a cargo transport unit with her profits in order to transport the sugar cane and return to planting several more hectares in order to supply her own juice business.  This will be her first loan with MFP. She is pleased to know that she will be able to rely on a line of credit to continue with her business. Consequently, she says she will be responsible in making her payments so that she will have a good credit history and access to more loans in the future. She also notes that she is comfortable with her communal bank since she knows all of the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people. 

She will invest the 1,000 nuevos soles as part payment on the purchase of a cargo transport unit so that she can transport the sugar cane from her plot to her sales stall, thus saving freight costs.

loans.use: to pay for the transport of sugar cane.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is a 26-year-old married man from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. He is the father of three children. Murad sells cooked corn from a cart. He is requesting a youth loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to improve his cart. He hopes to have a modern one to put in one of the high class shopping malls.

loans.use: to improve the cart he uses for selling cooked corn

loans.name: Angela Oneyda

texts.es:
Angela Oneyda tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos de 7 y 1 año de edad, vive en Santa Cruz de yojoa.
Angela, por la necesidad de obtener ingresos propios para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, hace cuatro meses inicio su propio negocio de elaboración de tortillas de maíz. Hace tortillas normales y especiales para tacos por encargo. Ella le dedica el tiempo necesario a este negocio.
El préstamo que solicita es el primero, del cual va invertir en comprar el maíz y otros insumos necesarios para elaborar las tortillas para vender, de donde espera obtener buenos ingresos. 
Su plan es trabajar fuerte para superarse y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angela Oneyda, age 33, is the single mother of two children, ages seven and one.  She lives in Santa Cruz, Yojoa.

Out of the necessity to get her own income to support her children, Angela started her own business of making corn tortillas four month ago.  She makes regular tortillas and special tortillas for tacos by order.  She devotes the necessary time to this business.

The loan she is requesting is her first.  She will use it to buy corn and other supplies she needs to make the tortillas to sell.  She hopes to get good income.

Her plan is to work hard in order to improve herself and to get ahead with her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en:
Sam Ol, age 38, is married. She resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for more than 10 years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are also involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Additionally, her husband runs a public transportation service (motor taxi) to generate extra income to support the family. 

They earn approximately $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s standard of living, Sam Ol is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a tuk-tuk (three-wheeled vehicle) for her husband's public transportation service. This purchase would enable her husband to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business breeding pigs to generate extra income for the family and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk-tuk (three-wheeled vehicle) for her husband's public transportation service.

loans.name: Anzhik

texts.en:
Anzhik, age 55, runs a small shop in the village of Noramarg, where she trades in food items. A self-motivated and independent woman, Anzhik started her business three years ago, and since then she has successfully managed the shop and created favorable conditions for its continued development. 

In order to meet client demand and offer a larger variety of products, Anzhik has applied for a loan. Anzhik expects an increase in sales and working capital, which will allow her to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en:
Fayzeh is a 23-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Fayzeh has a home-based project; she sells perfumes and accessories and is requesting a youth loan of 500 JD to purchase accessories and perfumes for business purposes.

Fayzeh is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and perfumes for business purposes

loans.name: Opiyo

texts.en: Opiyo is 30 years old and married with two children. He sells water to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy water tanks to store water for sale.

loans.use: To buy water tanks to store water for sale.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
Jose es una persona muy trabajadora que desde temprana edad tuvo que abandonar sus estudios y dedicarse a las labores del campo debido a problemas familiares. Jose cuando empezó a trabajar comenzó haciéndolo para una familia en su finca, allí Jose sembraba cultivos en la tierra de la finca y de esta manera pudo generar ingresos para su hogar y al mismo tiempo aprender a realizar su actividad con mayor calidad. Posteriormente Jose, gracias a que es muy ordenado con su dinero, pudo comprar una casa con un terreno en el cual convive con su familia. Jose es casado y es padre de 5 hijos, a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida. Gracias a que su terreno se encuentra en muy buenas condiciones para tener un cultivo, Jose ha sembrado algunas verduras y legumbres en él, y además Jose aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de semillas y abonos para aumentar su cultivo en su terreno y poder generar mayores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Jose espera que de esta manera su esposa y sus 5 hijos puedan acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro poder brindarles a sus hijos el acceso a una educación superior. Jose sueña con tener una gran comercializadora de legumbres donde pueda generar mucho empleo para las personas más necesitadas de su región.
texts.en:
Jose is a very hard worker who early on had to leave school and engage in farm work due to family problems. Jose started by working for a family on their farm, where Jose planted crops on the land belonging to the farm. He was thus able to generate income for his household and at the same time learn to improve the quality of his work.

Because he is well organized financially, Jose was eventually able to buy a house with some land where he lives with his family. Jose is married and the father of five children, for whom he always wanted to provide a good quality of living. Because his property is well suited to planting crops, Jose has planted some greens and vegetables on it.

Jose hopes that a loan will give him the opportunity to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will increase crop yield in his field and generate more revenue for the upkeeping of his family.

Jose hopes this way to provide his wife and five children with a better quality of living, and in the future to be able to give his children access to higher education. Jose dreams of operating a large vegetable market where he can create many jobs for people in need in his region.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers to boost crops in his field and generate increased revenue for the upkeeping of his family.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen with his family. He makes a living managing his grocery store, where he offers a variety of staple products. He is a very successful entrepreneur because he has a good location in the central bazaar of his home city. He is a skilled person who has seven years' experience in this business and has some regular customers who give excellent references.

The food products he sells are very popular and in high demand. His biggest dream is to improve his and his family's quality of life. Day by day, he thinks of ways to make his business grow, as it is his main source of income and this is the only way he can improve his and his family's living conditions. 
Because of this, he has made the decision to request a youth loan of 350,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to invest in his business by buying wholesale products, such as eggs, rice, beans, bread, oil, biscuits, sweets, and soft drinks. He fully trusts in God and that his work will produce favorable results in order to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products such as eggs, rice, beans, bread, oil, biscuits, sweets, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin, shown here with her loom, is a scarf weaver. She is the widowed mother of two sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home, one has full-time employment, and one stays at home. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Chhin is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase cotton thread and other weaving materials, the purchase of which will allow her to continue her scarf weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her scarf weaving business

loans.name: Altagwa Group

texts.en:
ALTAGWA is a group which is comprised of five women: Najiba, Habiba, Qumria, Nadia and Hadiah. They are from Sana`a, Yemen and work together to be able to help one another. They are hard-working, enterprising women who do not give up easily. They work hard every day to improve their families’ quality of life by making embroidery. Currently they are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to increase their business levels.

Najiba is the leader of the group (she is the third woman from the right.) Thirty years old and a married woman, she has two children. She has been embroidering cloth then selling it to customers for three years, which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. She says that she always has many orders from her customers, especially since she offers good quality in her embroidery work and it is not very expensive. It has helped her to provide for her family.

She is turning to AMB to request a youth loan of 30,000 YER since she has orders and would like to be able to fill them for her customers. She would like to purchase fabrics, needles and other items. This is why she is requesting this second loan with the other members of the group.

In the future, she would like to achieve her potential by opening an embroidery shop  where she can distribute her goods to the market.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, needles and other items for her business

loans.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino, de 60 años, un señor muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Eugenia de 50 años y su 07 estimados hijos a quienes brinda amor y un bienestar. La labor que realiza Marino es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de café. Hace 45 años tiene el conocimiento de la agricultura; es por ello que se hace conocido con los vecinos de su localidad, por tal motivo acuden a Marino para que les pueda ayudar con sus trabajos. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; y gracias a ello  y a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan productivas; puesto que así llega a obtener  buenas ganancias. El crédito solicitado es para la de compra de plantones de café para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Este será su crédito número 13 con MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo y en su banco comunal es muy colaborador. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café para incrementar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Marino, 60, is a hardworking man who lives in his own house with his wife Eugenia, 50, and their seven children, to whom he offers love and wellbeing. Marino works as a farmer growing coffee plants. He has developed his knowledge of agriculture over 45 years, and he is known throughout his neighbourhood for his expertise. For that reason, his neighbours come to Marino to ask for help with their own work. He feels very committed to his work; it is thanks to that and to the hard work he puts in every day that his plants are now very productive, and he is therefore able to earn a good income.

The loan Marino has asked for is to buy coffee plants for grafting, so he can enjoy the fruits of his labour in less time. This will be his 13th loan with MFP. He is very grateful for the support and he is an active member of his communal bank. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy coffee plants to grow on his land.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru: Идигул замужем и любящая мать одного ребенка. Муж работает электриком. Более 11 лет она занимается купле- продажей детской одежды. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы улучшить свое жилищные условия. Идигул хотела бы получить займ в размере 8000 Сомони для покупки детской одежды с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Idigul is married and is a loving mother of one child. Her husband works as an electrician. She has been reselling children's clothing for more than eleven years. She is a very hardworking woman. She wants to expand her business to improve her living conditions. Idigul wants to receive a loan in the amoun tof 8,000 somoni to buy children's clothing with the purpose to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy children’s clothes.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en: Yar, a 30-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are in school, lives in Bor, South Sudan where she has been selling fish for three years. Yar first heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and she is now requesting her fourth loan for 1200 SDG in order to purchase more fish to sell. She will use the income arising from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose is 34 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged between 6 and 9 years old.  She sells second-hand clothing. The hours of her business are from 8 am to 6 pm.

Gloriose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second-hand clothing to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en: Zoya is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and son. Zoya has been involved in farming for 15 years.  She keeps greenhouses where she grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables.  The conditions of the greenhouses have gotten worse in the last years, and this makes it difficult to create favorable conditions for fruits and vegetables to grow. So Zoya wants to renovate her greenhouses and solve this problem. She also plans to use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. This loan will help Zoya to gather a richer harvest this year and insure a better life for her family by renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and renovate her greenhouses

loans.name: Srin

texts.en:
Srin, shown here with her husband, lives in Kompong Cham province. She is now 48 years old and a mother of seven children, four of whom are dependent on her income, while the other three have started their own families around the province. Srin been cultivating rice for over 10 years.

Srin is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for rented farmland upon which she will grow potato crops in the coming season. Srin has been with HKL for many years, and this will be her tenth loan with us. A good client who repays her loans regularly and punctually as scheduled, she wants to save some money to buy a few hectares of farmland for her potato crops in the future.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en:
Khuon is 46 years old. She a a widowed mother who is responsible for four single children. She lives in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is involved in an agricultural business. She cultivates rice on her inherited farmland. From this business, she is able to generate an average of $5 per day to support her standard of living. Presently, two of her children are working in various jobs in Phnom Penh city: her daughter works for a restaurant and her son works as a Japanese translator. 

Khuon is taking out this loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle so her two children can commute to their workplaces without taking a motor-taxi service. In the future, Khuon wants to open a medium-size grocery store from her house to serve people in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин трудолюбивый и целеустремленный юноша. Более 4-х лет он занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродукции. В основном он выращивает пшеницу и бахчевые культуры. В бизнесе помогают родители и брат. Фахриддин запрашивает займ в размере 300$  США для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. Он надеется на вашу помощь милосердие.
texts.en: Fakhriddin is a hardworking and purposeful young man. He has been growing and selling crops for more than four years. He mainly grows wheat and melons. His parents and brother help him in this business. Fakhriddin is asking for a loan in the amount of $300 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
