Oriol is 45 years old and married to Estefania, 40. Together they have 6 children. They live in their own home in the district of Sivia. Oriol is a kind person who has worked farming cocoa beans and fruit trees for 25 years. He began this work alongside his dear wife in order to provide for their family's needs, particularly to feed and educate the younger children. Just like any other father, he is always concerned about the well-being of his family. For this reason he works every day with his crops, planting more cocoa and fruit trees so he can have good harvests and higher earnings in the future.

Oriol is happy that, thanks to his job, he has purchased a new plot of land to plant plantains and pineapples. This will be his second loan with MFP, and he is committed to repaying it on time. With the 4,000 nueves soles he will buy plantain seeds.

loans.use: buy plantain seeds

loans.name: Bayardo Antonio

texts.es: El señora Bayardo , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus cinco hijos , es padre soltero , labora desde hace varios años para una empresa constructora como albañil , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia , es de muy escasos recursos ya que sus salario no le permite realizar de una sola vez la inversión de terminar de construir un baño , actualmente se tienen que levantar muy temprano para poder  bañarse y cerrar con plástico para que los vecinos no les vean, con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción
texts.en: Mr. Bayardo lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his five children. He is a single father and has worked for several years for a construction company as a mason. He plans to make improvements for his family's lives. He does not have much money and his salary does not provide him with enough money at one time to invest in finishing construction of a bathroom. They currently have to get up very early to bathe and cover the bathroom with plastic so their neighbors can't see them. He will use the loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert de 33 años de edad convive con Roxana de 30 años fruto de este gran amor tienen 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Robert es un albañil con mucha experiencia en esta actividad  cuenta que desde muy joven trabaja realizando edificaciones. En un inicio trabajaba en la ciudad de lima en donde empezó como ayudante y que poco a poco aprendió este oficio hasta que un día fue contratado como maestro albañil  para construir una vivienda de 2 pisos lo cual era su primera obra del que salio exitoso. Ahora Robert vive y trabaja en el distrito de Pichari, volvieron porque ya los problemas sociales que les toco vivir se calmaron y continua realizando sus edificaciones, a la vez cuenta con una pequeña extensión de terreno agrícola con cultivos de cacao y frutales que conjuntamente con su querida esposa trabajan con la finalidad de obtener mejores ingresos. Robert está contento con el trabajo que tiene porque le deja buenas ganancias, mas adelante él esta pensando abrir una tienda de abarrotes en la vivienda que tiene. Este es segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que él se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 4,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de una amoladora para su trabajo, asimismo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, contratando peones.
texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old and lives with Roxana, 30. They have two children and live in their own home in the district of Pichari. Robert is a mason and has a lot of experience doing this work. Ever since he was very young he was worked in the building trade. He started out working in the city of Lima as a helper and little by little he learned the trade until one day, he was hired as a master mason to construct a 2 story home. This was his first job and it made him very successful.

Now, Robert lives and works in the district of Pichari. They returned because the social problems they had experienced had settled down. He is still building and also has a small plot of land where he farms cocoa and fruit trees with his sweet wife. They work together to have more income. Robert is happy with the job he has because it provides him with good earnings. In the future he is thinking of opening a grocery store in his home. This is his second loan with MFP and he is committed to repaying it on time. He will use the 4,000 nuevos soles to buy a grinder for work and invest in maintenance of his farm by hiring laborers.

loans.use: buy a grinder for construction and hire laborers

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 37 years old and is an internally displaced person who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and one son. For the past 10 years, he has been a farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. He chose this business because it  is profitable and in fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy and many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are on every table in Azerbaijan and they also make fresh punch.

Adil sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN and his wife actively helps him to raise crop.

As this products are in high demand, Adil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Kaba

texts.en:
Kaba is 30 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are in school. She lives in Bor. For the past three years, Kaba has run a food stall. She learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this will be her second BRAC loan.

Kaba is requesting an 800 SDG loan to purchase beans and oil. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha, de 34 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Guillermo de 40 años y sus 03 adorables hijos quienes son el motivo de todas sus energías.
Bertha, es una mujer de con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su esposo a l igual que sus hijos le apoyan con los trabajos de la chacra; cultivando plantas de café, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mas difícil es no lograr eliminar a las plagas que aquejan sus frutos, pero aun así persiste en incrementar plantas de café ya que es lo mas le gusta, no solo porque sean rentables al venderse sino que también es una forma de distraerse plantando con voluntad para luego ver sus frutos de buena producción. 
Este será su crédito número 14 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece la confianza que le está otorgando su grupo comunal.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá comprando plantas de café para injertar en sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
34-year-old Bertha lives in her own house with her 40-year-old husband Guillermo and their three adorable children, who are the reason for all their hard work. 

Bertha is a woman who really wants to get ahead; Her husband as well as her children help her with the farm work, cultivating coffee plants. She has been doing this for 15 years and thinks the most difficult part of it is not being able to get rid of the diseases that plague the beans, but even so she persists in increasing the coffee plants, since it's what she likes the most--not just because it is profitable to sell them, but also because it is a good way to entertain herself, planting of her own free will so that later she can see the fruits of her good harvest.

This will be her fourteenth loan with MFP, which is why she promises to faithfully pay her payments. On top of that, she appreciates the trust that the communal group is giving her. 

She will invest the 2,000 nuevos soles in coffee plants to put into her farmland.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Intizar

texts.en:
Intizar is a 43 year old married woman with four children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Intizar has bred cattle for the last 7 years. Formerly, she was a housewife but her husband`s salary was too low to cover the family's needs so Intizar decided to start her business.  She receives 100 AZN in monthly government financial support but this is insufficient to cover her family's needs.

Intizar usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5 to 6 months and then resells them for a higher price in the livestock bazaar to earn a profit. Her monthly income is 350 AZN and this business is a main source of financial income in her family. Intizar also sells home products. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Intizar also keeps dairy cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.   She wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She applied for a 1000 AZN loan in order to purchase one dairy cow and one calf.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow and one calf.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is 55 years old and married with two children. He is an internally displaced person who lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. He breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products along with cattle to be butchered for meat. Elman also raises sheep. He has more than 10 years of experience in this field and his father taught him how to best look after livestock. He receives 80 AZN in monthly support from the government, but this is too low to cover his family's needs.

Elman usually buys small cattle to raise and fatten over five or six months and then resell for a profit at the local livestock bazaar. He also sells milk and yogurt to his neighbors. These activities bring him 340 AZN monthly as his products are very popular in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are present in everyday life.   

Elman is requesting an 1,100 AZN loan to purchase one calf, one milk cow, and fodder.  He lacks the income to meet the basic needs of his beloved children. This will be his third loan from AqroInvest and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy a calf, a milk cow, and fodder

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, es un hombre muy laborioso y pendiente al cuidado de su hogar; tiene 49 años y vive con su esposa Olga de 48 años y sus 06 hijos en su propia casa a base de madera. En la localidad de Villa vista los campesinos son muy dedicados a sus campos de cultivo; uno de ellos es el señor Pedro, quien se dedica a labrar y cultivar plantas de café y un poco de cacao; lleva 34 años realizando esta actividad y para él es muy fácil realizar el trabajo que desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron. Ahora con la ayuda de sus hijos se van a realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas como: desyerbando, fumigando; para que ninguna plaga afecte sus producciones. En los tiempos de cosecha contrata a jornaleros para que le apoyen en extraer sus frutos y de esa manera lleguen a terminar rápido; después lo lleva a comercializar a los centros de acopio en la ciudad de San Francisco quienes le gratifican muy bien por cada kilogramo. Sin embargo le es muy difícil llevar hasta muy lejana ciudad por motivo a que los pasajes son muy altos. Con el tiempo espera en seguir haciendo crecer sus cultivos para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Asimismo se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mas plantas de café para incrementar en su chacra y con la otra mitad comprará abono para mantener fuertes a sus plantas.
texts.en:
Pedro is very hard-working and attentive to the care of his home. He is 49, and lives with his wife, Olga, 48, and their 6 children in their own wood house.  In the Villavista area the peasants are very dedicted to their farming; one of these is Pedro who culivates coffee and a little cacao.  He has been doing this work for 34 years and it is easy for him since his parents taught him the skills when he was very young.  Now his children help him with the care of the plants by weeding and spraying to protect the crops from diseases.  During harvest time he hires farmhands to help him pick the fruit so that they finish quickly.  Afterwards he takes the fruit to sell in the collection centers in San Francisco where he is paid well per kilo.  Nevertheless it's difficult to transport the crops to such a distant city because the fares are very high.  
In time he hopes to increase his crops so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.  This is his first financing with MFP and he is hoping for a small loan to help him with his plans.  He promises to be prompt with his payments and will use half the money to buy more coffee plants to increase his production and the other half to buy fertilizer to keep his plants strongs.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es: Dennis de 23 años es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo con el que vive en una casa alquilada ubicado en el distrito de Llochegua. Dennis es una joven madre dedicada a la venta de cosméticos desde los 17 años, ella cuenta que ingreso a este negocio gracias a la invitación que le hiciera una tía suya. Es así que recorre todos los caseríos del distrito de Llochegua vendiendo sus productos de manera ambulante donde siempre vende sus productos así como también los deja a crédito a sus clientes conocidos a razón de que cuando regrese puedan cancelar la deuda. También cuenta con una pequeña tienda en donde expende sus productos, mas que nada los días domingos porque es en ese día que se lleva a cabo la feria y se reúnen todas las personas de los anexos con la finalidad de realizar sus compras, por ello tiene que aprovechar al máximo a cuanto cliente llegue a su establecimiento. Dennis está contenta con el negocio que tiene, porque le genera una buena rentabilidad aunque le es muy agotador recorrer todos los caseríos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles incrementara nuevos productos para su tienda.
texts.en: Dennis is a 23-year-old single mother. She and her son live in a rented house in the district of Llochegua. Dennis has been selling cosmetics since she was 17. She says she got into the business when an aunt invited her. She goes from door to door selling her products in every village in Llochegua. She also offers her regular customers credit so that they can pay off their debts when she returns. She also has a small shop where she sells her products, especially on Sundays, market day, when people come from all over to do their shopping. She takes advantage of the chance to sell to any customer who comes to her shop. Dennis is happy with her business because she makes good money, although it is exhausting to visit every village. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles to buy more products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni de 25 años de edad, casado con Andres de 34 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Llochegua. Marleni es un persona muy detallista para las ventas, ella se dedica a la venta de artefactos en su tienda que está ubicado en el mercado del distrito de Llochegua, por el momento sus ventas se mantienen estables porque siempre está renovando sus productos acorde con el avance de la tecnología  y al gusto del cliente. Marleni, no siempre vende en su tienda si no que sale a las ferias de los pueblos aledaños del distrito de Llochegua, en donde trata de vender de manera ambulante con el apoyo de su menor hijo quien le ayuda a cuidar la mercadería. Marleni está contenta con el negocio que tiene porque le es rentable, pues gracia a ello viene construyendo su nueva vivienda, en donde más adelante abrirá su nueva tienda de artefactos con el único fin de seguir creciendo como negociante. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de nuevos artefactos.
texts.en: Marleni is 25 years old. She and her husband Andres, 34, have two children. They live in a home they own in the district of Llochegua. Marleni is a great salesperson. She sells appliances in her store, which is in the Llochegua market. She is able to keep up her sales because she's always bringing in new products as technology advances and client needs change. Marleni doesn't always make her sales in her shop; sometimes she goes out to the markets in the villages nearby, where she goes door to door with her younger son, who helps her look after the merchandise. Marleni is happy with her business because it allows her to make a living. Thanks to the business, she is building a new house, where she plans to open a new appliance store in the future and keep growing as a businessperson.This is her second loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on time. She will invest the 2,500 nuevos soles in buying new merchandise.

loans.use: to buy appliances for her shop.

loans.name: Evi

texts.es:
Evy de 42 años de edad, madre soltera, con 3 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Llochegua. Evy es una mujer trabajadora, desde muy joven se dedicaba al negocio en la tienda de su madre en donde aprendió los tips de cómo hacer que un negocio sea exitoso, como tratar a un cliente. De esa manera se hizo tan conocida por los vecinos, pero cuándo decidió formar su familia empezó con el mismo negocio al que se dedicaba, pero tenia una debilidad, que es el no contar con suficiente capital como para llenar la tienda de productos, pero poco a poco fue juntando dinero mas el crédito que le facilitaron en MFP, incremento su  mercadería. Ahora su tienda es la mas concurrida, por los precios bajos que tiene sus productos y el trato cordial al cliente.
Evy esta contenta y agradecida a MFP, por el primer crédito que la facilitaron pues gracias a ello incremento su mercadería. Por tanto éte será su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella está feliz con su banco comunal por que son puntuales y solidarios.
Con los 2,500 nuevos soles comprará más productos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Evy is 42 years old and a single mother of three. They live in a home they own in the district of Llochegua. Evy is a hardworking woman who started working in her mother's store from a very young age. It was there that she learned how to run a successful business and how to treat customers. She became quite well known among the locals, but when she decided to start a family, she set up a business of her own. Unfortunately, she lacked the capital to fill the shop with products, but she's slowly been saving money and has been able with the help of a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma to increase her stock. Now her store is the most popular around because she has low prices and treats her customers well.
Evy is very happy and grateful to MFP for the first loan it gave her, which allowed her to increase her stock. This will be her second loan, which she is committed to paying on time. She is happy with her village bank because they are efficient and supportive.
She will use the 2,500 nuevos soles to buy more products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her business.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Luis, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, su esposa tiene una pequeña pulpería en la casa de habitación  para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar  ya que tiene un hijo que va a clases por las mañanas, él labora en un restaurante desde hace siete años , con muchos esfuerzos han logrado construir gran parte de la vivienda , pero la situación económica no les permite seguir invirtiendo de una sola vez en materiales de construcción , especialmente para poder poner el piso , ya que actualmente es de tierra y todas las cosas que tienen  se están dañando. El préstamo lo quiere para poner el piso del hogar .
texts.en: Luis lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife. His family is making plans to improve their living conditions. His wife has a small grocery store that is located in their home, which helsp with household expenses. They have one child who is in school in the mornings. Luis has worked in a restaurant for the past 7 years. With much effort he has succeeded in building the majority of his home, but their economic condition does not allow them to continue investing in building materials in large amounts at a time, specifically to be able to put in a floor. Currently they have a dirt floor which is damaging their belongings. He has requested a loan to be able to put the floor in his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Claudia , es una humilde comerciante del mercado Oriental , ella habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos , su esposo labora en una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Claudia necesita que se le apoye para poder construir un cuarto para sus hijos ya que todos duermen juntos  y no gozan de privacidad ,  ya que con las ganancias de  la frutas y verduras que venden  logra cubrir algunos gastos ya que también su hijos estudian para que se formen y sean jóvenes de bien. El préstamo lo quiere para comprar bloques, cemento, arena , piedrín , tablas , hierro , entre otros productos .
texts.en: Claudia is a humble vender in the Oriental market. She lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children. Her husband works in a private business to be able to contribute to the household expenses. The plans they have for the future are to improve their living conditions. Claudia needs your support so that she will be able to build a bedroom for her children; currently the whole family sleeps in the same room and they don't have any privacy. With the profit she makes from selling fruits and vegetables she has succeeded in covering some costs. Their children are studying so that they are raised well and behave. The loan she is requesting is to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, gravel, boards and rod iron, as well as other things.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Esta casada con Uladislao quien es comerciante y padre de sus 3 hijos de 16, 10 y 4 años de edad. Juntos viven en la comodidad de su propia casa que compraron con el fruto de sus ahorros de varios años. La actividad que realiza Julia es la venta de pescado fresco que compra todos los días en las madrugadas en el puerto pesquero de la localidad, luego los dividen en dos partes, una la vende su pareja de manera ambulante en un bandeja con su mototaxi recorriendo las calles de los pueblos jóvenes; y la otra parte la vende ella desde su casa, donde instala una mesa en el frontis por las mañanas, atendiendo muy amablemente a su clientes. 
Se inicio hace más de 5 años con un capital propio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades, que fue aumentando viendo la demanda de sus productos.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, logrando acabar todo lo que vende, ya que es un alimento muy consumido en la localidad. Antes de empezar con su negocio, tuvo dificultades económicas ya que los gastos aumentaron con la llegada de su segundo hijo,  y ella tiene el deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación para que logren su realización personal, además de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Por tanto y viendo los buenos resultados que está consiguiendo con su negocio,  desea continuar e incursionar en la venta de ropa para aumentar sus ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además esta contenta con su banco pues le gusta el apoyo de brindan a las personas con deseos de superación.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de ropas de variados modelos y tallas que traerá desde la capital, buscando conseguir precios cómodos.  También invertirá en la compra de su mercadería de pescado para  la venta  en su negocio ya que sus precios están que suben.
texts.en:
Julia is 32 years old, she is hard working and very determined to get ahead. She is married to Uladislao who is a salesman. He is the father of her 3 children, who are 16, 10 and 4 years old. They live together in their own home, which they were able to buy as a result of many years of savings. Julia makes a living selling fresh fish, which she buys in the early morning everyday at the fishing port of the town. She divides what she sells in two parts, one for her husband, which he sells going door to door, transporting it in a tray in his moto-taxi through the streets of the town. The other part she sells from their home, setting up a table in front of their house in the mornings where she attends to her customers with a very friendly manner.    

She started this business more than five years ago with her own capital, buying in small quantities, increasing as demand for her products increased. She considers her business to be very profitable based on the earnings she is left with and that she sells everything she has available. It is a food that is commonly eaten in the area.

Before she started her business she was struggling financially because their expenses increased after she had her second child. She had a desire to provide her children with a better quality of life and a good education so that they can reach their full potential. Also, she wanted to be able to help her husband pay for the household expenses. For these reasons and because of the good results she continues to have with her business, she wants to continue and start a new business venture selling clothes, to increase her income. 

This will be her 3rd loan with the institution of MFP. She is very happy to know she has financial support, which makes her more secure in moving forward with her business. She is also happy with her communal bank because she appreciates the support they provide to people who have hopes of overcoming. With the amount of 1,200 Nuevos Soles she will invest in the purchase of various styles and sizes of clothing, which she will bring from the capital, in order to get good prices. She will also invest in fish to resell in her business, because prices are going up.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and to also buy clothes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar, además de ser alegre y amable. Es conviviente con Carlos quien es empleado y padre de sus 2 hijos: Janer y Fernando de 15 y 7 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo y esmero. La actividad que realiza Doris es la venta de bebidas gaseosas de variados sabores y marcas. Todos sus productos le llegan semanalmente de la distribuidora y los vende desde su casa, contando para eso con una refrigeradora que compró con sus propios ingresos, además vende refresco de diferentes sabores. También cuenta con un empleo de medio tiempo por las mañanas en la municipalidad de su distrito, en el área  de limpieza pública. Se inició en su negocio hace más de 8 años con un capital propio, contando con la ayuda de su pareja en la atención ocasionalmente.
Considera a su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, siendo un ingreso adicional para sus gastos del hogar.
Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenía dificultades económicas, ya que el precio de los alimentos sube constantemente  y sus ingresos no les alcanzaban, decidiendo generarse un ingreso adicional que le ayudara con sus gastos. Logrando superar estos problemas y viendo la acogida que tiene su negocio desea continuar y mantenerlo. Además desea retomar su negocio de venta de comidas. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta estar a gusto con su banco comuna  por la ayuda que vienen brindando a  las personas con deseos de progresar. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes necesarios para la venta de comidas como arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros. Además de comprar gaseosas a por mayor para surtir su negocio y obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Doris is 38 years old.  Aside from being happy and friendly, she’s a lady with a great desire to get ahead.  She lives with Carlos, who is the father of her two sons, Janer and Fernando, ages 15 and 7.  They live together comfortably in a home of their own, which they bought after much effort and hard work.  Doris sells carbonated soft drinks of many brands.  Her products are delivered to her weekly from the distributor and she sells them out of her home.   She has a cooler that she bought with her own income and she sells different flavored drinks.  She also has a part time job in the mornings, when she works cleaning for one of the towns in the district.  She started her own business with her own capital, more than eight years ago, while occasionally receiving help from her partner.  She considers her business to be profitable because it provides her with a good extra income for the household expenses.

 
Before starting her business, she had some financial difficulties, since the price of food constantly rises and she didn’t have enough income.  She decided to generate an additional income to help with her expenses.  Having resolved those problems and seeing the success that her business has had, she would like to continue it.  She also wants to restart her prepared food business.  This will be her fifth loan through MFP.  She is requesting a small loan so that she can meet her objective.  She also says that feels comfortable with her communal bank, because of the help they give people with a desire to get ahead.  She will invest the 1,500 PEN she is requesting in ingredients, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other things for her food business.  She will also buy soft drinks in quantity to stock her business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and soft drinks.

loans.name: Katy

texts.es:
Katy, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer de muchas ideas e ilusiones con su futuro, tiene muchas ganas de progresar, además es alegre y amable con las personas. Es conviviente con Denis quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de su 3 hijos: Diego de 11, Jeyson de 9 y Elda de 5 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su priora casa que lograron comprar con sus ahorros mutuos. La actividad que realiza Katy es la venta de ceviches, realizando la preparación es su casa y la venta de manera ambulatoria en un mototaxi de su propiedad que conduce su pareja y que acondicionó especialmente para esa actividad, recorriendo las calles de la ciudad ofertando su producto diariamente atendiendo cordialmente a sus clientes.
Se inició hace más de 4 años con un capital propio frutos de los ahorros mutuos con su pareja más un préstamo particular, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja en la preparación y venta.
Considera su negocio rentable porque logra acabar en vender todo el producto que prepara diariamente, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Antes de empezar con su actividad, trabajaba de ayudante en un restaurante cevicheria  donde aprendió la preparación y vio lo rentable que es el negocio, además de tener problemas económicos para solventar los gastos de su familia 
Por tanto viendo la mejora económica que ha logrado hasta el momento, desea continuar con su negocio y en un futuro abrir un restaurante cevicheria. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación del ceviche ya que los precios están subiendo y la inversión cada día tiene que ser mayor, por eso buscará precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen, para así continuar con buenos márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Katy, 36, is a woman full of ideas and dreams for the future. She wants to move forward in life and is very cheerful and kind to others. She lives in common law with Denis, who works in transportation, and they have three children: Diego (11), Jeyson (9) and Elda (5). They live in a house of their own that they bought with their savings. 
Katy sells ceviche. She prepares it in her house and sells it on the streets, using a mototaxi (driven by her partner) that she owns and customized for her business. She goes around the city streets on a dayly basis, offering her product and treating her customers very kindly.
Katy started this business over 4 years ago, investing some savings that were put together by her and her partner and a private loan. So far, her partner has supported her preparing and selling the ceviche. 
She considers her business to be profitable because everyday she gets to sell all her product and receives good profits. Before starting her business, Katy worked as a kitchen aid at a ceviche restaurant where she learned how to prepare this dish and how profitable the business is. At the time she had economic pressures, as it was hard to cover all her family expenses. Now her economic situation is better, so she wants to stay in business and open a ceviche restaurant in the future. This will be her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to learn she will receive financial support because this means she will be able to move on with her business. She also likes her Communal Bank because all the members are responsible and supportive. With the requested loan of 1000 nuevos soles, Katy will purchase the necessary ingredients for making ceviche because the prices are rising, demanding a higher investment on her behalf everyday. She will therefore seek lower prices through buying bulk amounts, which will allow her to keep her profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase fish, vegetables and other ingredients for making ceviche.

loans.name: Xotchil Cristina

texts.es: La señora Xotchil , originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante. Nos dice  que el primer prestamos Kiva le ayudo mucho  pues le permitió surtir su negocio , compro mercadería nueva para vender en su tienda de ropa, agrego nuevos artículos tales  pantalones jeans de dama, blusas, vestidos, bolsos, zapatos, ropa para caballero,  además de mejorar las ventas durante la época de ventas navideñas . Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado que la impulsa a salir adelante. Ahora solicita este crédito para comprar nuevos artículos tales como mochila, artículos escolares, uniformes de colegio zapatos. Unja de sus hijas le ayudara a vender la nueva mercadería de las cuales espera que las ventas sean muy buenas. Ella desea seguir esforzándose para salir adelante
texts.en:
Sra. Xotchil is a merchant who is originally from Granada. She says that her first Kiva loan was a great help since it allowed her to restock her business. Xotchil bought new merchandise to sell in her clothing store and added new items such as trousers, women's jeans, blouses, dresses, handbags, shoes, and men's clothing. In addition, she improved her sales during the Christmas season. She is very grateful for the support that has been provided and will propel her forward.

Xotchil is now requesting a loan to buy new items such as backpacks, school products, school uniforms, and shoes. One of her daughters helps with selling the new merchandise in hopes that sales will be good. Xotchil wants to continue getting stronger so that she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise such as backpacks, school items, school uniforms, and shoes.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 46 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de tener muchas ganas de progresar. Es conviviente con Ofelia quien es ama de casa  y madre de sus 5 hijos de 16, 14, 11, 6 y 3 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Carlos es la compra y venta de granos variado como maíz y otros. Todos estos productos los compra a los productores en sus terrenos y los vende al por mayor entre los comerciantes de al zonas cercanas y mercados, logrando buenas ganancias ya que logra venderlos muy rápidamente y a buen precio por la demanda de estos productos. Se inició hace más de 6 años con un capital propio haciéndolo rotar y aumentar de a poco, viendo crecer su capital y hasta el momento lo realiza solo. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda de sus productos. Antes de empezar en ésta actividad tenía dificultades económicas ya que no contaba con un oficio y teniendo la necesidad de mantener a su familia y educar a sus hijos le motivaron a empezar con su negocio. 
Ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar y aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías para ver crecer su negocio, también desea invertir en la extracción de madera, ya que ha visto que es un negocio rentable. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Se siente agradecido ya que contará con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con sus planes. Por tanto, comenta será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Por otro lodo, le gusta su trabajo con su banco comunal pues dan facilidades de acceso a líneas de créditos  a las personas que lo necesitan.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en el pago de personal para su nuevo negocio de extracción de madera y el  traslado de la madera a los aserraderos para su venta.
texts.en:
Carlos is 46, and a hard-working determined man, besides being very eager to progress in life. He lives with his partner Ofelia, who is a housewife and the mother of their five children, ages 16, 14, 11, 6 and 3, whom he loves very much. They live together comfortably in their own house, that they built with a great deal of effort. 

Carlos buys and sells a variety of grains such corn and others. He buys all these products from the growers on their land, and sells them at wholesale among the traders in the nearby areas and markets. He earns good profits, as he manages to sell them quickly and at a good price, because of the demand for these products. 

He got started six years ago with his own capital, making it turn over and increase little by little, and seeing his capital grow. Up to now, he has been doing this on his own. He considers his business quite profitable, because of the good earnings it provides, and the demand for his products. Before starting this business he had financial difficulties, as he didn't have a trade. Having to support his family and educate his children motivated him to start his business. 

Now, seeing the good results, he plans to continue and increase his stock of merchandise, in order to see his business grow. He also wishes to invest in  timber extraction, as he has seen that this is a profitable business.

This will be his fourth loan with the MFP institution. He feels grateful, because he will be able to have financial support to go forward with his plans. So he says he will be responsible in making his installment payments, as with his earlier loans. Moreover, he likes working with his communal bank, as they provide access to lines of credit to people who need it.

With the requested amount of 1,000 nuevos soles, he will pay workers for his new timber extraction business, and pay for transporting the wood to the sawmills to be sold.

loans.use: To pay workers for extracting timber, and pay for transporting it.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que no le teme  a los retos contando con mucha experiencia en los negocios.  Esta casado con Miluska quien es comerciante y madre de sus 4 hijos. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa en compaña de 2 de sus hijos: Denis y Sarai de 19 y 9 años de edad respectivamente. El trabajo que realiza Javier es la venta de pescado fresco por las mañanas que compra en el puerto pesquero de la localidad, y la venta la realiza de manera ambulante contando con un triciclo acondicionado con un parlante para ofertar su producto. También cuenta con un mototaxi que lo alquila a un chofer cobrando un promedio de 25 nuevos soles diarios,  generándose un ingreso adicional.
Se inicio hace más de 7 años con este negocio, contando con un capital propio y luego fue aumentando con préstamos, contando con el apoyo de su esposa en la venta.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, ya que generalmente logra acabar todo lo lleva para vender. 
Comenta, se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un oficio pues no cuenta con una profesión, y así  tener los ingresos necesarios para solventar los estudios de sus hijos, logrando educarlos siendo esa la mejor herencia que les pueda dejar, además de  considerarlo más rentable que su anterior oficio de albañil, viendo sus ganancias a diario.
Por tanto,  viendo sus buenos resultados, desea continuar con su negocio para mantenerse. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además  de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de pescado en mayor volumen para su negocio ya que con la escasez los precios están subiendo y se tiene que invertir mayor capital, deseando encontrar precios poco más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Javier, who is 56 years old, is hard-working and determined and does not fear challenges, since he has a lot of experience in business. He is married to Miluska, who is a merchant and the mother of their four children. Together they live comfortably settled in their own home in the company of two of their children, Denis and Sarai, who are 19 and 9 years old, respectively. Javier's work is selling fresh fish, which he buys in the mornings at the local fishing port and sells as a street vendor, using a tricycle set up with a speaker to offer his products. He also has a motorcycle taxi which he rents to a driver, obtaining an average of 25 PEN daily, thus generating an additional income.

He began this business more than six years ago, using some of his own capital, and then he augmented it with loans, with his wife helping him with the sales. He feels that his business is reasonably profitable because of the earnings that it gives him, since he generally sells everything that he has to offer. He comments that he decided to begin his business out of the need to have a job, since he does not have a profession, and thus to have the necessary income to pay for his children's schooling, since managing to educate them is the best inheritance that he can leave them. In addition, seeing his daily earnings, he considers it more profitable than his last job as a mason.

Therefore, seeing his good results, he wants to continue with his business to keep it going. This will be his third loan with MFP, so he hopes for your help to continue with his goals. In addition, he feels comfortable in his communal bank because he considers it a united and community-minded group. With the 1000 PEN that he has applied for, he will purchase fish in larger volume for his business, since with the scarcity prices are going up and he has to invest more capital. He wants to find slightly lower prices by making his purchases in volume.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marlon, es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, soltero con muchas ganas de superarse, él desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar las tierras, pero por problemas económicos no ha logrado sacar un buen cultivos, ya que hay que darle  un buen mantenimiento por ejemplo en el verano necesita aplicar exfoliante y refrescante para que la planta se mantenga con vida  .El préstamo lo va a invertir en fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para su debida inducción .
texts.en:
Sr. Marlon is a humble farmer from the District of Ticuantepe. He is single and has tremendous desire to succeed. When he was a young boy, his parents taught him how to cultivate the land. Due to financial problems, Marlon has not been able to have a successful crop even though he provides good maintenance. For example, in the summer, he needs to apply fertilizer sprays and refreshers so that his plants remain healthy.

This loan will be invested in fertilizers and necessary supplies that need to be applied.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана с супругом и двумя сыновьями – 9 и 4 года – живет в Ивано-Франковске, Западная Украина. Она – рыночный предприниматель, занимается торговлей галантереей: ремнями, сумочками, кепками, блейзерами и тапками. У Светланы всегда умеренно низкие цены, что дает ей преимущество перед другими рыночниками с подобной группой товаров. В бизнесе Светлана уже 8 год. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 6 000 гривен. 

Светлане необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы оплатить аренду торгового места, а также закупить ассортимент ремней, сумок и мужских блейзеров. Светлана – прагматичный предприниматель. Она заранее готовится к весне и потеплению и хочет обновить ассортимент товара для молодежи. За счет полученной от бизнеса прибыли Светлана надеется доделать ремонт в квартире, в которой живет вместе с семьей. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Svetlana lives with her husband and two sons—nine and four years of age—in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. She is an entrepreneur selling accessories at the market: belts, handbags, caps, blazers and slippers. Sveltana always keeps her prices affordable which gives her an advantage over other market vendors offering similar wares. Svetlana has been in business for almost eight years. Her monthly income is about 6,000 UAH.

Svetlana needs a loan of 20,000 UAH in order to pay the rent on her market stall and also to stock up on belts, handbags and men’s blazers. Svetlana is a pragmatic vendor: she starts planning for the spring and warmer weather in advance and would like to renew her assortment of wares for young people. Svetlana hopes to use her revenues in order to finish repairs in the apartment where she lives with her family.

Note: this business description is in Russian.

loans.use: to pay the rent on her market stall and also to stock up on belts, handbags and men’s blazers.

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.es:
Macedonia de 39 años, es madre soltera, tiene 03 hijos a quienes brinda amor y sobre todo mucha atención; juntos viven en su propia casa a base de material noble. Macedonia, desde que se separó con su esposo, se preocupo por el bienestar de sus menores hijos a quienes brinda mucho amor. Desde entonces tuvo que esforzarse para seguir adelante y tenia que ver una forma de cómo poder solventar con los gastos de su hogar; entonces un día se dio cuenta que poco a poco venía gente nueva a su Distrito; desde entonces empezó a incrementar cuartos en su vivienda para que pueda alquilar a un precio cómodo; esta actividad lleva realizando durante 08 años y hace que sus inquilinos se sientan cómodos. Lo que ahora prioriza es que pueda terminar con la fachada de su casa para poder seguir alquilando cuartos y de esa forma ver los gastos educativos de sus tres hijos. Este será su crédito número 11 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos; además en su banco comunal es una socia responsable.
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará pintura para poder terminar el pintado de su casa y de sus cuartos.
texts.en:
Macedonia is 39 years old. She is a single mother and has three children to whom she offers love and, above all, a lot of attention. They live together in their own house, which is well constructed. Macedonia, since she separated from her husband, has worried about the well-being of her minor children, to whom she offers much love. Since then she has had to make an effort to advance and she had to find a way to pay the household expenses. Then one day she noticed that little by little new people were coming to her district. Since then she began to add rooms to her house so that she could rent them at an affordable price. She has been doing this for 8 years and feels that her renters are comfortable. Now her priority is to be able to finish the front of her house to be able to continue renting rooms and in this way be able to pay for the educational expenses of her three children. This will be her 11th loan with MFP, so she hopes for your assistance to continue with her goals. Furthermore, she is a responsible member of her communal bank.

With the loan that she has applied for, she will buy paint to be able to finish painting her house and its rooms.

loans.use: to buy paint to improve the spaces in her bedrooms to rent them

loans.name: Mahabbat

texts.en:
Mahabbat is a 33 year old man, married with three children.  He is IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  Mahabbat has been breeding cattle and cows for the last 10 years. After several attempts to find job he gave up and decided to start his own business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Mahabbat usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for more a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 230 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income for his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday in dishes like pilau and dolma. Mahabbat also keeps milker cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

He wants to expand his business and improve life conditions for his family. He applied for 700 AZN loan in case to purchase one milker cow and fodder.  This will be the 2nd loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milker cow and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, es una mujer amable y esforzada; tiene 28 años de edad, convive con Palermo de 51 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Kevin 12 años y Yeny de 09 años; viven en su propia casa a base de material noble. Desde hace 10 años, Virginia empezó a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes; la primera vez  que abrió su bodega era muy inestable: ya que no tenía mostradores, estantes ni vitrinas, así que ella y su pareja dependiendo de la labor que cada uno realiza pues decidieron que  juntar sus ingresos con la finalidad de poder mejorar su estadía. Es así que su pareja lo apoya con los gastos y de esa forma llegaron a comprar vitrinas para su negocio, la cual ahora le va muy bien con sus ventas de manera que ya puede exponer sus productos. A ella le gusta su trabajo porque es algo tranquilo y rentable, al igual que también se dedica a sus menores hijos ya que están en etapa escolar y necesitan de mucha atención. Lo que aspira en la vida, es que sus hijos sean profesionales y es por ello que ella se dedica con mucho esmero a su trabajo. Este será su crédito número 13 con MFP, por lo tanto se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son solidarios.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará más productos de abarrotes para su tienda como: saco de azúcar, saco de arroz, fideos, variedades de detergentes, variedades de jabón, etc.
texts.en: Virginia is a nice and hardworking woman, she is 28, lives with Palermo who is 51 and their two children Kevin, 12 and Yeny 9, they live in a house they own made with reinforced concrete. 10 years ago, Virgina began selling groceries, the first time she opened the store it was difficult because she didn't have display furniture or shelves, so her and her partner decided to work hard at each of their activities and combine their income to make improve their store.  Her partner supports her with expenses and this way they were able to buy display furniture for the business, now sales are going well because she can show the products now.  She likes her job because it's quiet and profitable and because she can also take care of her younger children that are in school and need more attention.  She aspires to see her children become professionals and that's why she works hard at her business.  This is her 13th loan with MFP and she commits to make the repayments like she did with previous credits.  She also enjoys being part of the community bank because all its members are supportive.  With 3,000 new soles she will buy more groceries for her store such as: a sacks of sugar, rice, pasta, detergent, soap, etc.

loans.use: To buy a sacks of sugar, rice, pasta, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, de 34 años, es un hombre trabajador y responsable; vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Flor de 34 años y sus 06 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El señor Esteban, es un hombre muy dedicado a la actividad que labora en su carpintería; lleva 18 años trabajando junto a sus mayores hijos quienes le apoyan en todo, durante los fines de semana siempre se va a traer árboles madera desde la chacra y así poder elaborar diferentes muebles de la mejor calidad. Para él no hay nada difícil que le detenga en realizar su trabajo porque es lo que más le gusta y su pasión  es que a la gente le gusten los muebles que elabora. Con el tiempo su mayor anhelo es poder vender sus muebles a las tiendas más grandes de diferentes ciudades y así poder hacerse muy conocido. Lo que ahora prioriza es en comprar algunos materiales que ayuden en la elaboración de su trabajo. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago, para en otra oportunidad pueda acceder a otra.
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará una motosierra para elaborar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Esteban, who is 34 years old, is a hard-working and responsible man. He lives in his own house with his partner Flor, who is 34, and  their 6 beloved children, to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. Señor Esteban is a man who is very dedicated to his work, which is carpentry. He has been doing this work for 18 hears, working together with his older children, who help him in everything. During the weekends he always leaves to bring trees from the farm to make various furniture of the best quality. For him, there is nothing difficult that stops him from doing his work, because it is what he likes most and his passion is that people like the furniture that he makes. His greatest desire for the future is to be able to sell his furniture to the biggest stores in different cities and thus be able to become well known. For now, his priority is to buy some items that will help him in his work. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he promises to be very punctual in making his payments, so that he will have access to another loan at a future time.

With the loan that he is applying for, he will buy a chainsaw to use in his work.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw

loans.name: Gregori

texts.es:
Gregori de 36 años es una madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 10 años. Vive con ellos en una casa propia en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki – Chanchamayo. Gregori es una mujer agricultora. A sus 15 años ya sabía como funcionaba el negocio de sus padres, quienes también se dedican al campo, desde ese entonces ya conocía sobre tierras y productos. 
Actualmente cultiva café y plátanos. “Mis hijos mayores me ayudan y así me ahorro en pago de personal”, dice.
Tiene 4 parcelas las que al año le proporcionan de 10 a 20 sacos de café, cada uno de 70 kilos. Ella ya conoce a sus compradores, por eso no se preocupa en las ventas. Sus contactos llegan desde la ciudad de Pichanaki quienes sin dudarlo adquieren su producción.
Mientras el café crece y empieza a brotar sus granos, ella obtiene ingresos para solventar sus gastos diarios de la venta de plátanos, cuyas cosechas se dan a la semana. “Con el plátano no pierdo, todos los meses del año se cosecha y siempre hay ventas”, comenta contenta.
Con ese ahínco puede mantener y educar a sus hijos. El trabajo del campo es lo que el gusta hacer, por eso continuará con sus labores por mucho tiempo. Éste sería su crédito número 8 que obtendría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con responsabilidad las mensualidades. Menciona que, “Flor de San Juan” (su banco comunal) le ha brindado ayuda y satisfacciones por encontrar personas solidarias en su grupo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de plantas nuevas de café, con las que iniciará otra siembra.
texts.en:
Gregori is 36 years old and a single mother. She has three children who are 20, 18, and 10 years old. She lives with them in her own house located in the center of San Juan Centro Autiki, in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo. Gregori is a farming woman. At 15 she already knew how the business works from her parents who also make their living in the countryside. Since then she has known about the land and production. 

She currently cultivates coffee and bananas. "My older children help me and in that way I save on personnel costs", she says. 

She has 4 plots of land which each year produce between ten and twenty sacks of coffee at 70 kilograms each. She already knows her buyers and as such she does not worry about sales. Her contacts come from the city of Pichanaki and buy her products without fail. 

To make an income for her daily expenses while the coffee is growing and begins to bear fruit, she sells bananas, which she can harvest each week. "I can't lose with bananas. I can harvest them every month of the year and there are always sales to be made", she happily comments. 

With this diligence she is able to support and educate her children. She likes to work off the land, which is why she will continue with her work for a long time. This will be her eighth loan with MFP, which is why she gives her word that she will make her monthly payments responsibly. She mentions that Flor de San Juan (her communal bank) has given her  help and satisfaction in meeting dependable people in her group. She will invest the money in the purchase of new coffee plants with which she will begin another planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra, de 62 años, es una mujer alegre y hacendosa; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Benjamin de 61 años y su hija Gabriela de 20 años a quien desean un mejor futuro. Alejandra y su esposo se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, cuya actividad llevan realizando hace 20 años; después de tanto esfuerzo hoy tienen una buena ganancia económica por alquilar cada cuarto; este trabajo le gusta ya que es la manera de poder estar tranquilos ayudando a su hija. Alejandra ofrece sus cuartos con cama propia y a precios cómodos para que sus arrendatarios  se sientan como en su propia casa. Ahora lo que mas prioriza es en poder terminar la fachada del tercer piso de su hogar para que siga alquilando cuartos a los foráneos  de otros lugares. Lo que mas anhela es que su hija sea una profesional y tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo puntual como en sus anteriores cuotas. En su banco comunal es una socia cabal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará cemento y pintura para terminar con la fachada de su casa.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 62 years old. She is a joyful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband Benjamin, who is 61 years old, and her 20-year-old daughter, Gabriela, who they want a better future for. 

Alejandra and her husband make their living renting rooms. They have been in this business for 20 years. After much effort, they now make a good profit for each room they rent. She like this work because it allows them to live comfortably and help their daughter. 

Alejandra offers her rooms with their own bed at good prices so that her renters feel like they are in their own home. The biggest priority for her now is to finish the front of the third floor of her home so that she can continue to rent rooms to foreigners from other places. 

The thing she longs for most is that her daughter become a professional and have a better quality of life. This will be her third loan with MFP and she is committed to continue being punctual with her payments as she has been in the past. She is an upright member of her communal bank. With the 1,000 nuevos soles she will buy cement and paint to finish the front of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint to fix the front of her house.

loans.name: Lith

texts.en:
Lith lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 40 year old, married, and has three children. Two of them are still in school. 
Lith heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is 43 years old. She lives in Vosketas village with her husband, two sons, and daughter. The family earns its main income from agriculture: land cultivating and cattle breeding. Svetlana would like to develop farming but she needs the financial means. With the help of this loan she wants to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer to insure healthy growth of potatoes. Svetlana expects to gather a rich harvest which will help her not only to sustain her family during the year, but also to sell and earn additional income.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, 43, is married and resides with his wife and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running the business of buying cattle for resale at a profitable price for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. His wife is a homemaker. Two of his children are employed in a garment factory. They earn approximately USD 8 per day. In order to improve his family’s living condition, Ry is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more cattle for resale in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to use the further profit to expand his business and help his children get a bachelor degree. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it much stronger to provide a better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale in order to generate more income to support the family

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 32 years old, married with one child. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 6 years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Norman

texts.es:
Norman tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, vive en la Aldea San Gerónimo del Níspero Santa Barbará.
La actividad económica que le genera ingresos es la agricultura específicamente  el cultivo de café. Actividad que la aprendió a través de su padre desde que era niño le enseño a trabajar la tierra. El tiene un manzana de café y que con trabajo, dedicación y el respectivo mantenimiento que el le da a su cultivo ha hecho crecer su producción de café. Manifiesta que el precio de ese producto es muy rentable en el mercado. El piensa enseñar a sus hijos se dediquen también a esta actividad. Norman trabaja en su cultivo desde muy temprano todos los días de la semana.
El esta agradecido con ODEF por haberle otorgado sus segundo financiamiento de 10,000 lempiras para compra de fertilizante e insumos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo. El cual le ha ayudado mucho mejorando los recursos necesarios para el sustento de sus hijos.
Su meta es poder cultivar más tierra para lograr una mejor producción de café, y así generar buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Norman is 34 years old, single, and has two children who are 10 and 4 years old. He lives in the village of San Gerónimo del Níspero in Santa Barbará.

His agricultural business is how he makes his income, specifically cultivating coffee. He learned the business from his father when he was a boy who taught him how work the land. He has one manzana [about 1.72 acres] of coffee that with work, dedication and the necessary maintenance that he gives to his crops, has made his coffee production grow. He says that the price of this product is very profitable on the market. He thinks he will teach his children to make their living in this business as well. Norman works on his crops from very early in the morning, every day of the week. 

He is grateful to ODEF for having given him his second loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer and supplies to maintain his crop. It has helped him a lot in improving the resources necessary to support his children.

His goal is to be able to cultivate more land so that he can have better coffee production and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies to maintain the crop.

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana is a 41-year-old woman who is married with five children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She has her own small drug store where she has been selling medicine for the last seven years. She is an experienced and skilled person in this field.  She is also a cleaner in the local school and her monthly salary is about 30 AZN. 

Yegana usually sells the most necessary medicine in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 340 AZN.  She sells only certified drugs. 

She needs additional capital to invest in her business. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she sells and increase monthly turnover.  For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. This will be her second loan.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to cover market demand

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer buena y amable, además de ser trabajadora y emprendedora con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separada del padre de sus hijos pero le pasa una pensión para su alimentación. Vive en su propia casa en compañía de último hijo de 29 años y sus 02 nietos y sus hijos mayores ya son independientes. La actividad que realiza Juana es la venta de comidas como juanes, tamales, caldos de gallina y otros. Todos estos platos los prepara en su casa para luego venderlos de forma ambulatoria caminando por las calles de su vecindario. Se inicio con un capital de 10 nuevos soles vendiendo motes sancochados  que los ofrecía  de casa en casa, fue ahorrando sus ganancias y lo invirtió en la preparación de juanes , logrando la preferencia de sus clientes que la esperan a diario por la buena atención que les brinda y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la regular clientela que ha sabido ganarse con el pasar del tiempo.
Antes de empezar su negocio, tenía problemas económicos, ya que se había separado del padre de sus hijos, y necesita un ingreso económico para poder alimentarlos ya que con la pensión que les daba no les alcanzaba, también para tender un oficio y darles una mejor calidad de vida. Viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuaren su negocio, y con las ganancias comprar un unidad de transporte para alquilar y generarse más ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que contará con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso manifiesta será responsable con el pago de las cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además comenta le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal por la ayuda que brindan a las personas con el acceso a una línea de crédito. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los juntará a un capital propio y los invertirá en la compra un mototaxi de segundo uso valorizado en 2000 nuevos soles, para alquilarlo y  así generarse más ingresos, como también ahorrarse gastos de transporte.
texts.en:
Juana is 55, and is a friendly, good woman, besides being hard-working and enterprising, with a great desire to get ahead in life. She is separated from the father of her children, but he gives her alimony. She lives in her own home with her youngest son, 29, and her two grandchildren. Her adult sons are already independent.

Juana sells meals such as juanes (rice and pieces of chicken wrapped in banana leaves), tamales, chicken soups and other dishes. She prepares all these dishes in her home, to later sell them as a street vendor, walking along the streets of her neighborhood.  

She got started with 10 nuevos soles of working capital, selling motes sancochados (individual grains of corn boiled with cilantro) which she sold door to door. She saved her earnings little by little and invested them in the preparation of juanes, winning the preference of her customers, who wait for her daily because of the good service she offers them. Up to now she works on her own. 

She considers her business profitable because of the earnings it provides, and the regular clientele that over time, she has learned to win over. Before starting her business she had financial difficulties, as she had separated from the father of her children. She needed an income to be able to feed them, as the support her husband gave her wasn't enough; and also to help them them have a trade, and give them a better quality of life.

Seeing the good results, she has plans to continue with her business, and with the profits buy a transportation vehicle to rent out and generate more income for herself.

This will be her third loan with the MFP institution. She feels happy to know that she will have a line of credit to move forward with her business. That is why she states that she will be responsible in making her installment payments, as with her previous loans. In addition, she says that she likes working with her communal bank, because of the help they offer people in accessing a line of credit.  

She will use the requested amount of 1,500 nuevos soles, together with her own capital, to invest in the purchase of a second-hand mototaxi valued at 2,000 nuevos soles. This is in order to rent it out and generate more income for herself, as well as save herself transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in beauty supplies for new services.

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en:
Rahman is 40 years old. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and two children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cattle and has 12 years of experience in this field. 

Cattle breeding requires a lot of physical activity and spending most of the time in the open air. Pasturing takes 80% of Rahman`s time. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

Rahman would like to purchase more cattle and for this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He needs this loan to increase his monthly turnover and cover the needs of his customers. This will be his third loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 34 years old and married with four children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Asif has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle.

Asif usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. The milk and yoghurt, he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings 200 AZN income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use a yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are present in everyday life.   

This is the only financial income in his family and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Asif applied for a loan of 700 AZN to purchase one milking cow and fodder. This will be his third loan from AqroInvest and Asif has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Mareth

texts.en: Mareth, 60, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food and drinks for over seven years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband and two of her children are employed in the rice mill. They earn approximately USD 9 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Mareth is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more drinks to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a house with five rooms to rent for garment workers and help her children get a Bachelor Degree.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nyanchiek

texts.en:
Nyanchiek lives in Bor. She sells food and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are still in school. 

Nyanchiek heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy, 43, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a barber who earns about USD 5 per day. In order develop her family’s economy, Chanthy is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cattle to resell for a profitable price. This loan would enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 50 years old and married with three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sakina has been breeding sheep and cows for the last five years. When she retired, she was left without her daily bread, as her pension is only 60 AZN. She decided to start her business and with the help of her father, who was breeding animals for his entire life, they purchased their first cattle.

Sakina usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 3-5 months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 250 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in her family. Mutton is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sakina also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase five sheep, one milking cow and fodder.  This will be her second loan from AqroInvest CU and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy five sheep, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Sanna

texts.en:
Sanna lives in Bor. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are still in school. 

Sanna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 SDG in order to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng, 67, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of buying rice to sell for a profitable price for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately USD 3 per day. All of her children are employed in the garment factory. They earn approximately USD 9 per day. In order to improve her business, Heng is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to raise capital in her business for purchasing more rice to re-sell. By doing so, she would generate extra profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use further profits to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Saven

texts.en:
Saven, 39, is widowed and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running a business of buying palm leaf thatches for resale for a profitable price for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. 

Two of her children are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a construction worker. They earn approximately USD 6 per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Saven is requesting a loan of USD 700 to raise capital for her business to buy more palm leaf thatches for resale, in order to generate more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the extra profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to buy more palm leaf thatches for resale

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en:
Lusik is 48 years old. She lives in Sisian with her husband and two sons.
